page.title: 18TREES
page.content: Kirklevington is a village of trees. An old hall and a manor house once stood in Kirklevington. These were surrounded by extensive grounds and woods. Many of these old trees remain although new houses stand in the old hall and manor grounds. The top soil in the 'D' block is boulder clay.The sub soil is keuper marl which is good for growing trees. The ash,hawthorn,birch are some of the common trees found.In Ash Grove the council have protected 64 trees.They are all numbered. Some roads are named after trees :- {Birch Close, Ash Grove, Forest Lane, and{Grove Bank. Many elm trees are being felled because of Dutch Elm Disease. A new resistant strain has been found but none are planted as yet in Kirklevington.
